meanings.definition: To pester or annoy someone, especially by constantly asking for something.
meanings.sent1: Stop trying to noodge me for snacks all the time.
meanings.sent2: She would always noodge her brother to play with her.
meanings.sent3: The little girl would noodge her cat for a tea party.
meanings.sent4: The persistent rain continued to noodge the farmers' fields.
meanings.sent5: The buzzing mosquito would noodge us all night long.

meanings.definition: A person who persistently pesters or annoys others.
meanings.sent1: He can be a real noodge when he wants something.
meanings.sent2: The noodge at the office always asks too many questions.
meanings.sent3: The noodge in the group kept reminding everyone of the meeting.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a noodge buzzing around her friends.
meanings.sent5: The little brother was known as the family noodge.
